column4: anyone know how to change the resolution of the Ubuntu loading screen?
since installing ATI drivers its really low res
xrander can change the res of x
do I just run that in terminal?
yes
sudo?
I typed it, and I think you meant xrandr - and I know I want to set it to 1600x900 - but how do I set the splash screen to that?
the rez your running should be the same as the login
sorry, I don't know what the screen is called... not the login screen, the first one with the five dots
I think its purple, but I'm colourblind
oh to change that you need to pass a option in grub to change the rez of the framebuffer
how do I do that?
it used to be vga= but it got changed i dont knoe the new command
is there a room here I should ask in?
someone hear should know
is there a better way to ask?
its still vga= according to the ubuntu docs but i do not knoe the number you need for your rez
its vga=788 or 791 for the rez you whant
how do I change it?
editing grub in newer ubuntu is kinda tricky
why is it more tricky with the new version?
